abstract.p: James W Hamilton letter on Harvey Araton's May 16 article compares relative slap on wrist of Indiana University basketball coach Bobby Knight for choking player and harsh punish of Latrell Sprewell for choking coach; photo

block.p: Bobby Knight chokes one of his players and winds up with a three-game suspension for the next season and a $30,000 fine. Latrell Sprewell does the same thing to a coach and is suspended for a year from the N.B.A., thereby losing $6 million to $7 million in salary.

Bobby Knight chokes one of his players and winds up with a three-game suspension for the next season and a $30,000 fine. Latrell Sprewell does the same thing to a coach and is suspended for a year from the N.B.A., thereby losing $6 million to $7 million in salary.

A member of Indiana's current team, who suggesting that his coach's transgressions would soon be forgotten were the team to win a national title, a belief shared by many Knight supporters, does a disservice to those critical of Knight. They were concerned with the serious inappropriateness of his conduct over the years, and not whether he could continue to produce championship teams.
JAMES W. HAMILTON Sante Fe, N.M.
